profileAlternative.name: Joseph D. Darcy
profileAlternative.headline: Member of the Technical Staff at Oracle Corporation
profileAlternative.summary:
Joe is currently the technical lead for infrastructure in Oracle's JDK organization. This includes setting and implementing policies related to development practices in JDK 9.

Previously, Joe was the lead engineer of Project Coin and specification lead for JSR 334, the effort to select and implement a set of small Java language changes for JDK 7. From its inception in 2007 until March 2011, Joe was the release manager, lead engineer, and quality lead for OpenJDK 6, an open source implementation of the Java SE 6 platform. A longtime member of the JDK engineering group, Joe was previously specification lead for JSR 269, the Pluggable Annotation Processing API, which delivered a standardized annotation processing API and mirror-based language model into JDK 6, and remains maintenance lead of that effort. JSR 269 was a replacement for the earlier apt tool from JDK 5. Joe assisted in implementing the JDK 5 language changes with work spanning core reflection, javac hacking, and general library support.

Joe is a reviewer for multiple OpenJDK projects including JDK 6, JDK 7, JDK 7 updates, JDK 8, JDK 8 updates, JDK 9, and the on-going JDK and JDK updates projects.

Joe holds a master's degree in computer science from UC Berkeley and a master's degree in applied math from Stanford University.

Talk Archive, including JavaOne, Devoxx, and EclipseCon:
http://blogs.oracle.com/darcy/resource/SpeakingArchive.html

positions.title: Member of the Technical Staff
positions.description:
Java Platform Group

Current Projects: JDK feature release development, OpenJDK Compatibility and Specification Review (CSR) group lead, JDK Infrastructure Architecton.

Assorted on-going JDK core libraries work including but not limited to core reflection, annotations, enums, wrapper classes, and numerics; frequent contributor and reviewer of code changes to the JDK: http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk/jdk/search/?rev=darcy&revcount=250

Cross-release engineering responsibilities:
Since April 2010, chairman of the ccc, a JDK-internal process which reviews all API and interfaces changes to the platform. Superseded by being lead of the OpenJDK Compatibility and Specification Review (CSR) group since February 2017.

Annotation processing maintainer
Maintenance lead for JSR 269
Java Floating-Point Czar, owner of specification and implementation of numerical aspects of the Java platform including the java.math package and java.lang.Math and java.lang.StrictMath.

JavaOne Core Java SE track reviewer 2005-2010, 2013-2017

…
see more

positions.title: Senior Staff Engineer
positions.description: Member of JDK engineering team with responsibilities ranging from floating-point support to core reflection to open source release management.

educations.title: Stanford University
educations.fieldofstudy: ICME (Institute for Computational and Mathematical Engineering)

educations.title: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey-New Brunswick

items: Lead of Compatibility & Specification Review OpenJDK Group
IEEE 754r Working Group Participant (update to the floating-point standard)
Using annotation processors defined by modules with annotation processors defined by non-module code
System and method for conversion of numeric values between different number base formats, for use with software applications
Indicators for resources with close methods that do not complete erroneously in software programs
Indicators for resources with idempotent close methods in software programs
Efficient and expansive conversions between reference and primitive
Type inference of partially-specified parameterized types
Encoding switch on ordered universes with binary decision diagrams
Method and system for compiling a dynamically-typed method invocation in a statically-typed programming language
Annotation processing from source files and class files
Introspection support for local and anonymous classes
Fixed, Floating, and Exact Computation with Java's BigDecimal
